channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14349] pre-commit zombie finder is overly broad
item.description:
Zombie detector is flagging processes from builds that aren't ours.

ex from HBASE-14337:


-1 core zombie tests. There are 4 zombie test(s): at org.apache.reef.io.network.DeprecatedNetworkConnectionServiceTest.testMultithreadedSharedConnMessagingNetworkConnServiceRate(DeprecatedNetworkConnectionServiceTest.java:343)
item.summary: pre-commit zombie finder is overly broad

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
another from HBASE-14181


-1 core zombie tests. There are 5 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.qjournal.client.TestEpochsAreUnique.testSingleThreaded(TestEpochsAreUnique.java:93)

and HBASE-14158

and HBASE-14332

HBASE-14338


-1 core zombie tests. There are 1 zombie test(s): at org.apache.hadoop.yarn.server.resourcemanager.security.TestAMRMTokens.testMasterKeyRollOver(TestAMRMTokens.java:313)
Yep, saw these many times. Add a grep "hbase" to zombie detector?
sounds reasonable.

current zombie detector:


  ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT=`jps | grep surefirebooter | wc -l`

  if [[ $ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT != 0 ]] ; then

    #It seems sometimes the tests are not dying immediately. Let's give them 30s

    echo "Suspicious java process found - waiting 30s to see if there are just slow to stop"

    sleep 30

    ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT=`jps | grep surefirebooter | wc -l`

    if [[ $ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT != 0 ]] ; then

      echo "There are $ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT zombie tests, they should have been killed by surefire but survived"

      echo "************ BEGIN zombies jstack extract"

      ZB_STACK=`jps | grep surefirebooter | cut -d ' ' -f 1 | xargs -n 1 jstack | grep ".test" | grep "\.java"`

      jps | grep surefirebooter | cut -d ' ' -f 1 | xargs -n 1 jstack

      echo "************ END  zombies jstack extract"

      JIRA_COMMENT="$JIRA_COMMENT

     {color:red}-1 core zombie tests{color}.  There are ${ZOMBIE_TESTS_COUNT} zombie test(s): ${ZB_STACK}"

      BAD=1

      jps | grep surefirebooter | cut -d ' ' -f 1 | xargs kill -9

    else

      echo "We're ok: there is no zombie test, but some tests took some time to stop"

    fi

  else

    echo "We're ok: there is no zombie test"

  fi

the jps entries look like


Every 2.0s: jps | grep surefirebooter                                                                                                                                             Tue Sep  8 07:47:48 2015



36463 surefirebooter7254413731964488287.jar

so there's nothing that screams "hbase only." Anyone have any ideas? I guess we could track pids after we do the jstack dump and limit to those that look like hbase tests?

We can add a -Dhbase.tests or something like that to <argLine> for surefire and grep for that. We already have -Djava.security.egd=file:/dev/./urandom -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Djava.awt.headless=true, so maybe we can just add those to the grep (although it will be fragile).
We should also change jps to ps -aux.

I like the arg line approach.

What would changing to ps from jps buy us?

–
Sean

What would changing to ps from jps buy us?

jps does not print out the arguments to the command AFAIK, but ps aux or ps ef does. I was assuming we do something like this: 


ps aux | grep surefire | grep hbase.tests | cut -d ' ' -f 1 | xargs -n 1 jstack

Patch that marks hbase test processes with innocuous '-Dhbase.test' as per Enis suggestion. jps -v shows the jar name and args so can grep output for surefirebooter and -Dhbase.test.

test-patch.sh first KILLED any surefire found before we ran. Would explain some of the killed tests I've been seeing... kills without exlpaination. Such a kill might have made sense when we were only test on machine but that is no longer the case. Removed the kill.

Was going to commit this if local tests basically work... commit is only way to really try it.

Here is example output of jps -v with the little hbase.test marker added in:


kalashnikov:hbase.git stack$ jps -v

80574 Launcher -Dclassworlds.conf=/opt/local/share/java/maven3/bin/m2.conf -Dmaven.home=/opt/local/share/java/maven3

64989  -Dosgi.requiredJavaVersion=1.7 -XstartOnFirstThread -Dorg.eclipse.swt.internal.carbon.smallFonts -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Xms256m -Xmx1024m -Xdock:icon=../Resources/Eclipse.icns -XstartOnFirstThread -Dorg.eclipse.swt.internal.carbon.smallFonts

80627 Jps -Dapplication.home=/Library/Java/JavaVirtualMachines/jdk1.7.0_51.jdk/Contents/Home -Xms8m

80610 surefirebooter3686011305909643759.jar -enableassertions -Dhbase.test -Xmx2800m -XX:MaxPermSize=256m -Djava.security.egd=file:/dev/./urandom -Djava.net.preferIPv4Stack=true -Djava.awt.headless=true
Update identifier to be hbase.test rather than just hbase.
OK. Pushed to master. Lets see how it does.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6885 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6885/)
HBASE-14349 pre-commit zombie finder is overly broad (stack: rev e1fd3526b130d669ad02e2c55a91299f0bd4c15d)

  • dev-support/test-patch.sh
  • pom.xml

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.3 #243 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3/243/)
HBASE-14349 pre-commit zombie finder is overly broad (stack: rev c936393591289d5c5868afcf5ae0236e69c357b8)

  • dev-support/test-patch.sh
  • pom.xml

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-1.3-IT #218 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-1.3-IT/218/)
HBASE-14349 pre-commit zombie finder is overly broad (stack: rev c936393591289d5c5868afcf5ae0236e69c357b8)

  • pom.xml
  • dev-support/test-patch.sh

Noticed my patch was still picking up non-hbase projects (we'll also need to back port this fix if we want older builds to not pick up non-hbase processes)

grep -e SOMETHING -e SOMETHING_ELSE are not AND'd together as I thought. Addendum changes the -e to each doing individual greps.

Pushed to master.

FAILURE: Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #6887 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/6887/)
HBASE-14349 pre-commit zombie finder is overly broad; ADDENDUM (stack: rev 4beefd8ce4eb9d0bd1b57ac48a9d9dc011690155)

  • dev-support/test-patch.sh
So, the check is no longer overly broad. It may be broke... even. But it does not find tests from other builds anymore. Resolving.
